    Abstract Algebra and Real Analysis Self-Study Guide

    This is a self-study guide for introductory upper-division mathematics that I am currently compiling for my friend.

    Textbooks: Fraleigh â€“ A First Course in Abstract Algebra, 7th edition; Rudin - Principles of Mathematical Analysis, 3rd edition

    Abstract Algebra

    • Chapter 0: Sets and Relations
      • 0.7, 0.8, 0.9
      • Cardinality
      • 0.16, 0.17, 0.18, 0.20, 0.22
    • Chapter 1: Introduction and Examples
      • Roots of Unity
    • Chapter 2: Binary Operations
      • 2.1, 2.4
      • Tables
    • Chapter 3: Isomorphic Binary Structures
      • Definition of Binary Structures
      • 3.7
      • How to Show that Binary Structures are Isomorphic
    • Chapter 4: Groups
      • 4.1, 4.2, 4.3, 4.6, 4.8, 4.10, 4.12, 4.13, the part about GL(n, R)
      • 4.15, 4.16, 4.17, 4.18, and the remarks after 4.18 but before Finite Groups and Group Tables

      • Exercises: 0.18, 0.19, 0.29, 2.37, 3.17, 4.2, 4.9, 4.20, 4.31, 4.32, 4.41

      Extra exercise for chapter 0: Define a relation ~ on \( \mathbb{Z} \) by x ~ y iff x = y + n for n in \(\mathbb{Z}\). Show that ~ is an equivalence relation, and that there is a bijection between \(\mathbb{Z}\)/~, the set of all equivalence classes of \(\mathbb{Z}\) arising from ~, and the circle \(S^1\)
